00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodGTypeChipSummary.h
00024  * @author Alan Williams
00025  * 
00026  * @brief  Class for accumulating some run statistics from a genotyping run.

00030 #ifndef QUANTMETHODGTYPECHIPSUMMARY_H
00031 #define QUANTMETHODGTYPECHIPSUMMARY_H
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/BioTypes.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/ChipSummary.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/GenderCalls.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/QuantGTypeMethod.h"
00038 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodReport.h"
00039 #include "chipstream/SpecialSnps.h"
00040 #include "chipstream/SummaryStats.h"

00042 #include "stats/stats.h"

00047 #include <iostream>

00050 
00051 class QuantMethodGTypeChipSummary : public QuantMethodReport, public ChipSummary {
00052 private:
00053   enum CallType {
00054       total = 0,
00055       auto_total = 1,
00056       hom   = 2,
00057       auto_hom = 3,
00058       het   = 4,
00059       auto_het = 5,
00060       nc    = 6,
00061       auto_nc = 7,
00062       pra   = 8,
00063       cn0   = 9,
00064       
00065   };
00066 
00067   static const int CallTypeSize = 10;
00068 
00069 
00070 public: 
00071 
00072   QuantMethodGTypeChipSummary(const std::string& analysisName,
00073                               GenderCalls *genders,
00074                               SpecialSnpMap& SpecialSnps,
00075                               bool alleleSummariesOnly = false,
00076                               double minThreshold = -1 * DBL_MAX, 
00077                               double maxThreshold = DBL_MAX) {
00078     setValid(false);
00079     m_AnalysisName = analysisName;
00080     m_SpecialSnps = SpecialSnps;
00081     m_MinThreshold = minThreshold;
00082     m_MaxThreshold = maxThreshold;
00083     m_Genders = genders;
00084     m_AlleleSummariesOnly = alleleSummariesOnly;
00085     // set to reduce debugging warnings.
00086     setFormat(affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
00087     setFilename("QuantMethodGTypeChipSummary-DEBUG"); // for debugging, not used.
00088 
00089     if(m_Genders->getGenders().empty() == false) {
00090         declareMetric("computed_gender",ChipSummary::Metric::String);
00091     }
00092     declareMetric("call_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00093     declareMetric("total_call_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00094     declareMetric("het_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00095     declareMetric("total_het_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00096     declareMetric("hom_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00097     declareMetric("total_hom_rate",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00098     declareMetric("cluster_distance_mean",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00099     declareMetric("cluster_distance_stdev",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00100   }
00101 
00102   /** 
00103    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00104    * streams and print headers to files etc.
00105    * 
00106    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00107    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00108    * 
00109    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00110    */
00111   bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00112     bool allOk = true;
00113     int chipCount = iMart.getCelFileCount();
00114     for(int i=0; i<chipCount; i++) {
00115         std::vector<ChipSummary::Metric> metrics;
00116         m_SummaryStats.push_back(metrics);
00117     }
00118     m_Calls.resize(CallTypeSize);
00119     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Calls.size(); i++) {
00120       m_Calls[i].resize(chipCount);
00121     }
00122     m_MeanClosestDistance.resize(chipCount);
00123     return allOk;
00124   }
00125 
00126   /** 
00127    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00128    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00129    * 
00130    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00131    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00132    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00133    * 
00134    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00135    */
00136   bool report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantMethod &qMethod,
00137               const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00138               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00139     QuantGTypeMethod *gMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantGTypeMethod *>(&qMethod);
00140     bool realCalls = true;
00141     if(gMethod == NULL) {
00142       Err::errAbort("Can only use a QuantMethodGTypeReport with QuantGTypeMethods.");
00143     }
00144     Err::check(gMethod->getNumCalls() == m_Calls[0].size(), 
00145                "Error: QuantMethodGTypeChipSummary::report() - Wrong number of calls.");
00146     std::vector<double> distanceValues(gMethod->getNumCalls());
00147     /* Keep track of the calls. */
00148     const std::string probeSetName = ToStr(psGroup.name);
00149     bool autosomal = !isHaploid(m_SpecialSnps, probeSetName);
00150     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < gMethod->getNumCalls(); i++) {
00151       ///@todo Nice to get away from notion of GTypeCall. This is a hack which works with QuantLabelZMulti
00152       ///      because we are only interested in if the call is a hom or het.
00153       affx::GType forcedCall = gMethod->getGTypeForcedCall(i);
00154       double conf = gMethod->getConfidence(i);
00155       float dist = gMethod->getConfGenotype(forcedCall, i);
00156       if(!Util::isFinite(conf) || !Util::isFinite(dist)) {
00157         Verbose::out(1, "Warning! - Non-finite (Nan/Inf) confidence produced in probeset: '" + probeSetName + 
00158                      "' at column: " + ToStr(i));
00159       }
00160       if(dist == FLT_MAX) 
00161         realCalls = false;
00162       distanceValues[i] = dist;
00163 
00164 
00165       QuantLabelZMulti *qmm = dynamic_cast<QuantLabelZMulti *>(&qMethod);
00166       if(qmm != NULL) {
00167             int call = qmm->getCall(i);
00168             GenoCallCoder *coder = qmm->m_coder;
00169             if(coder == NULL) 
00170                 Err::errAbort("GenoCallCoder is NULL");
00171             if(coder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("NoCall") == call) {
00172                 m_Calls[nc][i]++;
00173                 if (autosomal) {
00174                     m_Calls[auto_nc][i]++;
00175                 }
00176             } 
00177             else if(coder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("PossibleRareAllele") == call) {
00178                 m_Calls[pra][i]++;
00179             } 
00180             else if(coder->abstractAlleleToGenotypeCallNum("ZeroCopyNumber") == call) {
00181                 m_Calls[cn0][i]++;
00182             } 
00183             else if(coder->isHom(call)) {
00184                 m_Calls[hom][i]++;
00185                 if (autosomal) {
00186                     m_Calls[auto_hom][i]++;
00187                 }
00188             } 
00189             else if(coder->isHet(call)) {
00190                 m_Calls[het][i]++;
00191                 if (autosomal) {
00192                     m_Calls[auto_het][i]++;
00193                 }
00194             } 
00195             else {
00196                 Verbose::out(1,"Unaccounted for call (" + ToStr(call) + "). Treating as no-call for summary stats.");
00197                 m_Calls[nc][i]++;
00198 
00199             }
00200       } 
00201       else {
00202             affx::GType call = gMethod->getGTypeCall(i);
00203             if (call == affx::AA) {
00204                 m_Calls[hom][i]++;
00205                 if (autosomal) {
00206                     m_Calls[auto_hom][i]++;
00207                 }
00208             } else if(call == affx::AB) {
00209                 m_Calls[het][i]++;
00210                 if (autosomal) {
00211                     m_Calls[auto_het][i]++;
00212                 }
00213             } else if(call == affx::BB) {
00214                 m_Calls[hom][i]++;
00215                 if (autosomal) {
00216                     m_Calls[auto_hom][i]++;
00217                 }
00218             } else if(call == affx::NN) {
00219                 m_Calls[nc][i]++;
00220                 if (autosomal) {
00221                     m_Calls[auto_nc][i]++;
00222                 }
00223             } else {
00224                 Verbose::out(1,"Unaccounted for call (" + ToStr(call) + "). Treating as no-call for summary stats.");
00225                 m_Calls[nc][i]++;
00226                 if (autosomal) {
00227                     m_Calls[auto_nc][i]++;
00228                 }
00229             }
00230       }
00231       m_Calls[total][i]++;
00232       if (autosomal) {
00233         m_Calls[auto_total][i]++;        
00234       }
00235     }
00236     /* if there were real predictions then keep track of them. */
00237     if(realCalls) {
00238       m_MeanClosestDistance.addData(distanceValues);
00239     }
00240 
00241     return true;
00242   }
00243 
00244   /** 
00245    * If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is
00246    * called rather than the normal report call above. By default does nothing.
00247    * 
00248    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00249    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00250    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00251    * 
00252    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00253    */
00254    bool reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, QuantMethod &qMethod, 
00255                       const IntensityMart &iMart, std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00256                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00257 
00258      // do nothing.
00259      return true;
00260    }
00261 
00262   /** 
00263    * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00264    * results and clean up.
00265    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00266    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00267    */
00268   bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod) {
00269 
00270     vector<affx::Gender> genders(0);
00271     if(m_Genders != NULL) {
00272         genders = m_Genders->getGenders();
00273     }
00274 
00275     // Load up other metrics computed in m_Stats
00276     for(size_t chip = 0; chip < m_SummaryStats.size(); chip++) {
00277 
00278         /// @todo should this be changed to m_AnalysisName + "_gender_used"? 
00279         if (genders.empty() == false) {
00280             m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("computed_gender", affx::getGenderString(genders[chip])));
00281         }
00282         // was added -- but now removing to reduce redundancy. analysis can be had from the
00283         // meta header info (which previously was not provided)
00284         //m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(m_AnalysisName + "_call_rate", getCallRate(chip)));
00285         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("call_rate", getAutoCallRate(chip)));
00286         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("total_call_rate", getTotalCallRate(chip)));
00287         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("het_rate", getAutoHetCallRate(chip)));
00288         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("total_het_rate", getTotalHetCallRate(chip)));
00289         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("hom_rate", getAutoHomCallRate(chip)));
00290         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("total_hom_rate", getTotalHomCallRate(chip)));
00291         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("cluster_distance_mean", m_MeanClosestDistance.getMean(chip)));
00292         // this little hack is here to suppress warning messages that would
00293         // probably vex some users.
00294         double distanceStdDev = (m_AlleleSummariesOnly ? 0 : m_MeanClosestDistance.getStdev(chip));
00295         m_SummaryStats[chip].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric("cluster_distance_stdev", distanceStdDev));
00296     }
00297 
00298     // @todo: this shouldnt be needed -jhg
00299     // zero out the header buffering (We have headers pushed ontous which we never use.
00300     m_header_buffer.resize(0);
00301     
00302     //
00303     setValid(true);
00304     return true;
00305   }
00306 
00307 private: 
00308 
00309   /** Get the autosomal call rate */
00310   double getAutoCallRate(int index) {
00311     return 100.0 * (m_Calls[auto_total][index] - m_Calls[auto_nc][index]) / m_Calls[auto_total][index];
00312   }
00313 
00314   /** Get the total call rate */
00315   double getTotalCallRate(int index) {
00316     return 100.0 * (m_Calls[total][index] - m_Calls[nc][index]) / m_Calls[total][index];
00317   }
00318 
00319   /** Get the autosomal het call rate */
00320   double getAutoHetCallRate(int index) {
00321     return 100.0 * (m_Calls[auto_het][index]) / (m_Calls[auto_total][index]);
00322   }
00323 
00324   /** Get the total het call rate */
00325   double getTotalHetCallRate(int index) {
00326     return 100.0 * (m_Calls[het][index]) / (m_Calls[total][index]);
00327   }
00328 
00329   /** Get the autosomal hom call rate */
00330   double getAutoHomCallRate(int index) {
00331     return 100.0 * (m_Calls[auto_hom][index]) / (m_Calls[auto_total][index]);
00332   }
00333 
00334   /** Get the total hom call rate */
00335   double getTotalHomCallRate(int index) {
00336     return 100.0 * (m_Calls[hom][index]) / (m_Calls[total][index]);
00337   }
00338 
00339 private:
00340   /// The name of our analysis.
00341   std::string m_AnalysisName;
00342   /// What level of confidence is needed to make a call?
00343   double m_MinThreshold;
00344   double m_MaxThreshold;
00345   /// Keep track of call counts per chip. Indexes are CallType enum
00346   std::vector<std::vector<int> > m_Calls;
00347   /// Distance to nearest cluster center.
00348   SummaryStats m_MeanClosestDistance; 
00349   /// Gender of sample.
00350   GenderCalls *m_Genders;
00351   /// map of haloid snp names
00352   SpecialSnpMap m_SpecialSnps;
00353   bool m_AlleleSummariesOnly;
00354 
00355 //   1) mean/stdev median absolute deviation
00356 //   2) allele summary.
00357 
00358 };
00359 
00360 #endif /* QUANTMETHODGTYPECHIPSUMMARY_H */
